pr_title: add transmission latency for MQ case

timeline.bodyText: You should not transport the timestamp if it is a 0, otherwise, 0 would provide a super huge false latency for this RPC.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: This is optional, you should add if (extensionParts.length > 1) {, then get (1) and parsing. Also, you need if not empty and try/catch to avoid the empty string as it is optional, and illegal character.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: Rename this to parseRPC, as it does more than it used to be.
timeline.author: wu-sheng
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -234,6 +234,12 @@ public void parseExit(SpanObject span, SegmentObject segmentObject) {
 
     private void setPublicAttrs(SourceBuilder sourceBuilder, SpanObject span) {

timeline.bodyText: We have a for span in the L240-L248 already, please don't do duplicated iteration.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: Why rewrite the latency of this? We never said the latency of span/segment/service including the network when we talked about the server-side latency.
replies.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: Should not bespan.getStartTime() - sendingTimestamp. At here, for you, the latency is current time - sending timestamp
timeline.author: wu-sheng
wu-sheng
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -124,4 +124,10 @@
      * Should skip analysis in the backend.
      */
     void skipAnalysis();
+
+    /**
+     * Get the start time stamp of this span.
+     */
+    long getStartTime();

timeline.bodyText: long -> Long, as it could be NULL if don't exist in the in-wire context.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

+package org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.context;
+
+/**
+ * Inject or read the extension protocol fields,such as {@link ExtensionContext#sendingTimestamp}.
+ */
+public class ExtensionInjector {
+
+    private final ExtensionContext extensionContext;
+
+    ExtensionInjector(final ExtensionContext extensionContext) {
+        this.extensionContext = extensionContext;
+    }
+
+    public void injectSendingTimestamp() {
+        extensionContext.setSendingTimestamp(System.currentTimeMillis());
+    }
+
+    public long readSendingTimestamp() {

replies.bodyText:
This comment is not addressed yet, I mark it as unresolved. @EvanLjp please only mark the conversation as "resolved" after you have actually resolved it or have reasons not to resolve, I don't see either.
Because sendingTimestamp is Long, returning it from public long readSendingTimestamp() will lead to an auto-unboxing and NullPointerException
replies.author: kezhenxu94

timeline.author: mrproliu

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * The latency of transmission. If there were more than one downstream endpoints, multiple tags will be recorded,
          
          
            
                 * The latency of transmission. When there are more than one downstream parent/segment-ref(s), multiple tags will be recorded,
timeline.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we should always serialize this part even if sendingTimestamp != 0? The extension fields are order-sensitive, we always need a real value or placeholder, otherwise, if the downstream agent plugin don't have this field but have their own extended fields(now for now, though), it will be trouble, WDYT? @wu-sheng
timeline.author: kezhenxu94

replies.bodyText:
Yes, my previous comment is about don't serialize the 0, but - should be included.
It seems to be misunderstood.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: I have similar concerns about this, so the zero is a placeholder before. WDYT? @wu-sheng
replies.author: EvanLjp

replies.bodyText: I don't like 0, as 0 is a real value, you are going to represent no value. So you could use 0- as timestamp doesn't exist.
replies.author: wu-sheng

timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText:
Because all parameters are passing rather than optional fields, the length of extensionParts is fixed.
now, the passing data maybe "0-" or "0-1602743904804", length of extensionParts must be 2.
in the feature, if add another field, the propagate data may be "0--" or "0-xxx-xxx". And the length of extensionParts must be 3.
I think logic greater than 0 is redundant
replies.author: EvanLjp

replies.bodyText: Don't require must, that is the key. If the new agent propagates 0-xxx-xxx, I hope the older agent still works, that is why I wrote this part as >0, and ask you to do >1.
replies.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: I finally understand the key: the compatibility.
replies.author: EvanLjp

replies.bodyText: Yes, this kind of PR shows me the case is, the extension header may be used more in the future.
replies.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: Please inject  (whitespace), rather than this strange replaceAll.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

replies.bodyText: I may have misunderstood what you meant, thinking you meant to pass as few characters as possible. fix it later.
replies.author: EvanLjp

replies.bodyText: The size is not a concern, as we have injected a much bigger sw8 header.
replies.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: Please use Long to separate real 0 and NULL.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: I think you misunderstand me, I mean no value should be represented by  , the separator should always be -.
timeline.author: wu-sheng

timeline.bodyText: I think this equal is incorrect, as it is an object for now.
timeline.author: wu-sheng
kezhenxu94

timeline.message: Merge branch 'adjustMqTimestamp' of https://github.com/EvanLjp/skywalking into adjustMqTimestamp
